'''Tommy Zicaro''' came into the ER with his brother, Dominic, who had gotten his hand stuck in a meat grinder.


While grinding meat, Tommy's brother, Dominic, got his hand stuck in the meat grinder. [[Callie Torres|Callie]] had [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] take the lead on the case, making the decisions for Dominic's care. Meredith initially believed they should amputate, but when she found a viable finger, she changed her mind and they made steps to save his hand. When they talked about cutting through the grinder to free his hand, his brothers objected, saying it was expensive. They said they had to take it apart every night to clean it anyway, so Callie let them take it apart to free Dominic's hand. To buy Dominic more time, they applied a tourniquet above the grinder.

Once they got it apart, Callie told his brothers to leave while they turned back the auger and released Dominic's hand. They didn't leave right away and when his hand was pulled out, they both passed out on the floor. His hand was severely injured and only two of his fingers were left attached. While Meredith and Callie were in the OR working on Dominic's hand, Meredith determined that one of his amputated fingers was still viable and could be reattached, but Callie said the thumb wasn't, so Dominic would be better off with a prosthetic as the thumb is responsible for % of hand function. Meredith suggested that they take his big toe to replace his thumb, but Callie said that his big toe is too important for his balance, so they'd take the second toe instead. They closed and went to get Dominic's consent.

Dominic's brothers thought it was weird, but Dominic agreed to the surgery. They took him back in and retrieved his second toe and attached it in place of his lost thumb.



Tommy owns a butcher shop with his brothers, Dominic and Mike. When Dominic got his hand stuck in a meat grinder, Tommy and Mike took it apart to free his hand.


Tommy and his brothers own a butcher shop.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Zicaro, Tommy}}

'''Trey''' is the boyfriend of [[Megan Waylon]].


Trey came into the hospital with his girlfriend, Megan, who was injured while riding his motorcycle. He stayed by her bedside and called for help when she complained of a headache, blurred vision, and tingling. When [[Meredith Grey]] came in, she banished him to the waiting room while they took Meg into surgery.



He is dating [[Megan Waylon]]. She was injured while riding his motorcycle.

{{Nurse Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Tyler Christian |status = Alive |alias = Ty Ty |title = R.N. |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[A Hard Day's Night]] |last appearance = [[You Be Illin']] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Moe Irvin]] }} '''Tyler Christian''' is a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] and has worked there for more than six years, even while it was still [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. During Izzie's first shift, she had a patient who needed a central line, but she didn't know how to do one. She went to Tyler, who informed her that she needed to wake Bailey to help her do it. Later, when [[Katie Bryce]] was having a seizure and Meredith showed up, he told Meredith she needed to calm down and decide what to do next. ''("[[A Hard Day's Night]]")'' Tyler was among the group that responded when Cristina called a code for Liz Fallon. He took her chart and saw that she was DNR and demanded that Cristina stop resuscitation. ''("[[No Man's Land]]")'' Tyler was the nurse assigned to Mrs. Patterson. When Mrs. Patterson needed a second surgery, he was sent to call for the OR. ''("[[Shake Your Groove Thing]]")'' He was part of the team that responded when Jimmy Harper coded. He helped get Izzie prepped to crack Mr. Harper's chest. ''("[[If Tomorrow Never Comes]]")'' When Cristina was hospitalized, Tyler caught her looking through patient charts. He read her own chart, which said she was supposed to be on bed rest and could only get out of bed to move to a chair. ''("[[Deny, Deny, Deny]]")'' Ellis was among his patients. She escaped twice while George was supposed to be watching her, which amused Tyler. ''("[[Deny, Deny, Deny]]")'' Tyler signed the get-well card for Joe when he was hospitalized due to his aneurysm. Tyler wrote that the first time he'd ever stepped foot in the hospital was to force Burke and Derek to perform surgery together and that he was always the one to rock the boat. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' After the train crash, Tyler came into the hospital and delivered the message to Meredith from Joe that Derek had come to the bar after she'd left, but he mistakenly called Derek "McSteamy." ''("[[Into You Like a Train]]")'' When Cristina upset [[Debbie]], Tyler helped her get her revenge by paging Cristina for every gross case all day. ''("[[Something to Talk About]]")'' Tyler was one of the nurses who went on strike to protest mandatory overtime. He, along with Olivia and Debbie, asked George to go inside to check on their patients. ''("[[Break on Through]]")'' When Mindy Carlson came in covered in blood, Tyler was shocked that none of the blood was hers. He helped get her cleaned up and then gave her medication to calm her down. ''("[[It's the End of the World]]")'' Cristina asked Tyler to guard Burke's hospital door so she could strip for him. However, when his parents interrupted, she confronted him. He said he had to respond to a code blue. They saved the guy's life and he used the $ she had paid him to buy everyone coffee to celebrate. ''("[[I Am a Tree]]")'' Tyler informed George when his patient, Dana Seabury, was caught shoplifting chocolate from the hospital gift shop. ''("[[I Am a Tree]]")'' Tyler was informed that Addison needed B+ blood in her OR for Noelle Lavatte, so he went to get it immediately. ''("[[Let the Angels Commit]]")'' When Eric Sanborn was hospitalized, Tyler was one of his nurses. He informed Cristina when Eric started vomiting up blood. ''("[[Where the Boys Are]]")'' When Burke was in the hospital, Cristina used Tyler to pass messages to him because they weren't speaking to each other. ''("[[Six Days, Part ]]")'' Higgins was a patient of Tyler's who needed diet orders, which Cristina provided. ''("[[Drowning on Dry Land]]")'' When Ellis Grey coded, Tyler helped Derek attempt to resuscitate her. He also informed Derek that Burke was doing cardiopulmonary bypass on Meredith. ''("[[Some Kind of Miracle]]")'' When [[Jane Burke]] came back to town to collect her son's belongings, Tyler hid Cristina in exchange for a waffle maker that he wanted that she'd gotten as a wedding gift. ''("[[Love/Addiction]]")'' When [[Charlie Yost]] was determined that he was going to die that day, he tried pulling off his monitor leads. Tyler wrestled with him over them and told him he could pull off his leads all he wanted and he wouldn't die from it. When Charlie coded shortly afterward, Tyler helped Izzie run the code and resuscitate him. He later informed Izzie that Charlie was checking out AMA. ''("[[Let the Truth Sting]]")'' When Nick's carotid blew, Tyler is one of the nurses who responded to the code. He held start a transfusion and after Nick died, he informed Lexie that his parents had gotten on a plane from California. ''("[[Crash Into Me, Part ]]")'' When Kyra Marshall was in isolation prior to a heart transplant, Tyler checked the doctors for fevers before working on her case. When Alex temped at .\ub, he was not allowed on the case. ''("[[The Becoming]]")'' When [[William Dunn]] was coding after bashing his head into his hospital bed, Tyler came to inform Meredith. ''("[[Stairway to Heaven]]")'' When Izzie had cancer, Tyler came in to check on her. She asked him if he knew where Meredith was. He didn't, but offered to page her. However, Izzie declined. ''("[[Sweet Surrender]]")'' During the hotel fire, Tyler informed the doctors that [[Cathy Becker]] was complaining of pain. ''("[[I Saw What I Saw]]")'' When [[Aaron Mafrici]] was loudly singing in the ER, Tyler told Alex that Aaron was the consult. ''("[[I Like You So Much Better When You're Naked]]")'' When Alex didn't see his patient, [[Emile Flores]], in his bed, he asked Tyler where he was. Tyler didn't know and assumed he had left. ''("[[Valentine's Day Massacre]]")'' When Tyler saw Owen behind the nurses' station taking a chart, he asked if he could help him, but was dismissed. ''("[[Suicide is Painless]]")'' After [[Gary Clark]] shot [[Pete (Season )|Pete]], Pete was brought to the ER. When his wife, [[Shelley]], arrived, she was worried he was dead, but Tyler assured her he wasn't. He then dismissed Clark when he asked Tyler to show him where Derek was. ''("[[Sanctuary]]")'' When Meredith was running the ER, Tyler was at the desk and helped her with several patients, including [[Oliver Richter]] and [[Mitch Turner]]. ''("[[Golden Hour]]")'' When there was a virus outbreak in the hospital, Shane went to Tyler and asked him to put the CCU on lockdown, because the conduit trial babies were in there. Tyler refused, but said Shane could take the three trial babies and put them in a separate area, which he could then close, though Tyler advised that he had no extra nurses, so Shane would be on his own. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")'' Tyler has made friends with many of the hospital's surgeons while they were still interns, particularly [[Meredith Grey]], [[Cristina Yang]], and [[Lexie Grey]]. Cristina paid him to guard the door while she stripped for Burke in a hospital room but he had to leave because a patient was coding and Burke's parents entered the room. Tyler later blackmailed Cristina into giving him an electrical appliance by lying to Burke's mother, Jane Burke, and telling her that Cristina was in surgery. Tyler worked as a surgical nurse for at least four years at Seattle Grace and helped out the interns a lot. He survived the merger and thereby became part of the staff of\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital|Seattle Grace Mercy West]]. Currently he is employed at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital|Grey Sloan Memorial]]. One of his shifts included running the [[Coronary Care Unit|CCU]]. *Tyler has been credited as Nurse Tyler Christian, Nurse, and Nurse Tyler. *Tyler is a possibly a charge nurse as he was in charge of the [[Coronary Care Unit|CCU]] during [[You Be Illin']]. *Tyler was the first person to say McSteamy, which went on to become Mark Sloan's nickname. He was referring to [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]]. '''Vic''' is the rapist who attacked [[Allison]].



Vic attacked Allison and attempted to rape her. However, his plans were thwarted when she bit off the majority of his penis. He still took the opportunity to beat her severely.


Long after the attack, Vic drove himself to the hospital, where he collapsed outside from the blood loss. He was taken inside the hospital, where they took him into surgery. They had the penis because Allison had swallowed it, but because it had been torn off by her teeth and partially digested in her stomach, they weren't able to reattach it. They were able to stop the bleeding and he was awake after surgery. While he was unconscious, he was arrested and handcuffed to his hospital bed.

'''Warren Griffith''' is a member of the flag football team that all got struck by lightning.


Warren was playing flag football with his team when they were all struck by lightning. He took he hardest hit and it branched out from him. While he was being examined, he said he felt a little queasy and was told it was probably from the impact. In the ER, he was told that Kerry was worried about him as he was about her.

He, along with [[Mitch (Grey's Anatomy)|Mitch]] and [[Russ Gammie]] went to see [[Kerry Schultz]] to confess their love. She told them all to shut up and then asked Warren to speak, but he coughed up blood. He was told he had a perforated bowel and was taken into surgery to repair it.

His surgery went well and afterward, he visited Kerry in her hospital room. He apologized for hurting her and for getting them all struck by lightning, but she said she wasn't sorry it happened and confessed her love for him.



He likes [[Kerry Schultz]]. When she was told about it, she reciprocated his feelings.


Warren, Mitch, Russ, and Kerry are friends who all play on the same flag football team.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Griffith, Warren}}

'''Wes Connors''' was one of [[Derek Shepherd|Derek's]] hopeless case surgeries.



Because of the pain caused by his tumor, Wes was being homeschooled by his mother. They went to  different battlefields in a year. They were planning to go to Pearl Harbor next, and possibly Normandy after that.


Wes was diagnosed with a neuroblastoma. Because she was concerned about him knowing about his condition, his mother didn't tell him about his tumor. However, he overheard some doctors talking about it, but he hid it from his mother that he knew. Eight different surgeons, including the tumor board at [[Cleveland Clinic]], said his tumor was inoperable. Wes's mother, Lynn, took him to Derek in the hopes that he'd be able to operate. He said he would try, but warned her that there was only a % chance he'd be successful. Once he opened Wes up, he discovered that there was no way he could operate without killing Wes, so he closed without doing anything.

After the surgery, Lynn told Wes that the surgery wasn't as hard as they thought it would be, but Wes figured out that they didn't actually do anything.



Wes' father died when he was . His mother was very protective of him, to the point where she didn't tell him that he had a tumor. When he found out about it anyway, he didn't tell her that he knew, because he said that the only thing that made her happy was thinking that he didn't know about his tumor.


*He was  years old at the time of his hospitalization.
*Fort Ticonderoga was his favorite battlefield.
*A surgeon in Boston compared removing his tumor to dismantling a bomb with your eyes closed and one in Chicago said it was like patching a dam with gum.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Connors, Wes}}

'''William Benson''' is the judge who presided over Meredith's hearing to keep her medical license.


William started the hearing to determine if Meredith could keep or lose her license to practice medicine. He looked at how many witnesses were on the list and said they needed to get started quickly. He listened as both sides questioned witnesses. When Meredith snapped and confronted [[Paul Castello]], who was set to vote on Meredith's license, William suggested they end the hearing while they looked into the conflict of interest and reschedule later. However, after Paul collapsed with a seizure and was taken away in an ambulance, Alex brought in a slew of patients whose lives were saved by Meredith Grey. William listened as they all sang Meredith's praises. Then Alex read a letter from Cristina about Meredith. He said he had others, but William stopped him and cleared the room so the panel could make their decision. The two remaining panel members voted for her to keep her license, rending Paul's vote irrelevant.


He is a judge.

'''William Thorpe''' is a [[Surgical Oncology|surgical oncologist]] at [[Bauer Army Medical Center]].



He was working on [[Brian Carson]], who had been diagnosed with osteosarcoma in his pelvis, spine, and sacrum. He was upset when [[Joel Miller]] called in a team of doctors from [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] to operate, preferring to use the standard chemo and radiation to treat him. He was upset when [[Callie Torres|Callie]] left the OR in the middle of surgery and didn't come back right away because she was trying to figure out how to cover a sizable gap in bone. Despite this complication, the surgery was completed successfully. ''("[[All Eyez on Me]]")''



[[Meredith Grey]]
When he and Meredith worked together on [[Brian Carson]], he flirted with her and asked to follow up with her. She initially didn't realize he was flirting, but once she figured it out, she went back and gave him her personal number. ''("[[All Eyez on Me]]")''

He then called her several times, but she didn't answer the phone. Still wanting to pursue her, Will came to the hospital and asked Meredith on a date in person. ''("[[Odd Man Out]]")''

Meredith agreed to go get drinks, but panicked and cancelled. However, he showed up at the hospital after she got out of surgery and offered to take her home. They got food and ate in the car, talking. ''("[[I Am Not Waiting Anymore]]")''

On their third date, Will and Meredith had sex. However, the morning after, Meredith yelled at Will, asking him to leave immediately. He later came to the house and she told him about Derek and said she thought she was ready, but she wasn't. He said he'd back off for a while and wait, but he'd call and then come back. He believed she was worth waiting for. ''("[[When It Hurts So Bad]]")''


He is a [[Surgical Oncology|surgical oncologist]] at [[Bauer Army Medical Center]].


*He had known [[Brian Carson]] since Medical Corps.<ref>[[All Eyez on Me]], x</ref>
*He really likes ketchup.<ref>[[I Am Not Waiting Anymore]], x</ref>
*He thinks Meredith is worth waiting for.<ref>[[When It Hurts So Bad]], x</ref>
*Three is his lucky number.<ref>[[When It Hurts So Bad]], x</ref>

'''Winnie''' was helped by [[Derek Shepherd]] after being in a car accident.



Winnie and her dad were out on a lake fishing when her dad had a sudden heart attack and died right in front of her.


Winnie was riding in a car with her mother, [[Sarah]], when [[Charlie Abbott]] sped by them and clipped their car swerving back into their lane, sending both cars flying. Sarah and Winnie's car landed on its side. Sarah became worried because Winnie wasn't answering her and she couldn't see her, but she was just not speaking because she thought she was dead. Derek found them and showed Winnie how to check her pulse to show that she's not dead. Derek used a tire iron to break out the back window of their car to retrieve a first aid kit they had back there and then guided Winnie out of the vehicle. He tried to send Winnie over to Charlie and [[Alana]] with some bandages to get her out of the way while he tended to Sarah, but she told him that she had seen her father die right in front of her and she wasn't afraid to see pain. Despite this, she agreed to go sit by Charlie and Alana.

When Charlie's car caught on fire, Winnie was the first one to notice and alerted Derek, who told Alana to get away from it and helped Charlie walk away. Winnie then helped Derek tend to Alana's abdominal injuries and sat with him while they waited to be rescued, as he told her the smoke from the car would lead people right to them.

Winnie went with her mom in the ambulance to the hospital and Derek said he'd come visit them in the hospital first thing in the morning.

When Derek arrived in the ER at [[Dillard Medical Center]] while her mother's injuries were being tended, Winnie recognized him and went to him. She checked the pulse at his wrist, noting that he was still alive and telling him to stay not dead. She then told the doctors, who were treating Derek as a John Doe, his name and that he was a surgeon who saved all of them after the car accident.



Winnie's father died right in front of her while they were on a lake fishing.


Winnie and Derek meet while he saved her and her mother from their car after their car crashed in front of him. He taught her to find her pulse and his "[[It's a Beautiful Night to Save Lives]]" phrase, which she later repeated back to him in the hospital. When asked by a doctor if Derek was a family member or neighbor, Winnie said that he was her friend and that he'd saved everyone. She was one of the last people to see Derek before his death.

'''Zona Cruz''' is the wife of [[Jorge Cruz]].



Zona's husband, Jorge, came into the hospital after falling down a set of stairs with a nail gun. As a result of the fall, he had accidentally fired seven nails into his head. When he arrived at the hospital, he was unable to see. The doctors did research into the best way to deal with the situation and only discovered that they should try to get them out as quickly as possible and watch for heavy bleeding. His wife then revealed that he'd been having headaches and dizzy spells, so after Derek removed the nails, he started looking for possible causes. The next morning, Jorge's sight had returned, but an MRI to check for bleeding revealed a tumor on his hypothalamus. Jorge was given his options. He could either have - quality years with focused radiation or he could have the tumor almost completely removed, which would give him - years, but since the tumor was where his personality lived, there was a chance he'd lose his memories and his personality. Jorge decided on the surgery and his wife supported his decision.



She is married to Jorge Cruz. They have a very loving relationship. She makes him a cheese omelet every morning for breakfast, which she says is the only thing he likes and he says is the only thing she knows how to make. When they had to choose between - good years or - years with Jorge's personality possibly being altered, Jorge chose the - years, which Zona supported, saying that he's still her Jorge and she'll remember their life together for both of them.


*Her favorite color is red.
